Package ManagersAndServices

Class CatmullRomSpline

java.lang.Object
ManagersAndServices.CatmullRomSpline
public class CatmullRomSpline
extends java.lang.Object
Simple implementation of an open Catmull-Rom-Spline

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static CatmullRomSpline create​(java.util.List<? extends java.awt.geom.Point2D> points, int stepsPerSegment, double alpha)
    Creates a new Catmull-Rom-Spline with the given control points.
    static CatmullRomSpline create​(java.util.List<? extends java.awt.geom.Point2D> points, int stepsPerSegment, double alpha, boolean closed)
    Creates a new Catmull-Rom-Spline with the given control points.
    java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Point2D> getInterpolatedPoints()
    Returns an unmodifiable list containing the interpolated points.
    void setInterpolation​(double alpha)
    Set the alpha value determining the interpolation: For 0.0, the spline is uniform.
    void updateControlPoints​(java.util.List<? extends java.awt.geom.Point2D> points)
    Set the positions of the the control points so that they match the given points.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static CatmullRomSpline create​(java.util.List<? extends java.awt.geom.Point2D> points, int stepsPerSegment, double alpha)
      Creates a new Catmull-Rom-Spline with the given control points.
      Parameters:
      points - The control points. A deep copy of the given list will be created internally. Thus, changes in the given list or its points will not be reflected in this spline.
      stepsPerSegment - The number of interpolation steps per segment
      alpha - The interpolation value. For 0.0, the spline is uniform. For 0.5, the spline is centripetal. For 1.0, the spline is chordal.
      Returns:
      The spline

    • create

      public static CatmullRomSpline create​(java.util.List<? extends java.awt.geom.Point2D> points, int stepsPerSegment, double alpha, boolean closed)
      Creates a new Catmull-Rom-Spline with the given control points.
      Parameters:
      points - The control points. A deep copy of the given list will be created internally. Thus, changes in the given list or its points will not be reflected in this spline.
      stepsPerSegment - The number of interpolation steps per segment
      alpha - The interpolation value. For 0.0, the spline is uniform. For 0.5, the spline is centripetal. For 1.0, the spline is chordal.
      closed - Whether the spline should be closed
      Returns:
      The spline

    • setInterpolation

      public void setInterpolation​(double alpha)
      Set the alpha value determining the interpolation: For 0.0, the spline is uniform. For 0.5, the spline is centripetal. For 1.0, the spline is chordal.
      Parameters:
      alpha - The alpha value

    • updateControlPoints

      public void updateControlPoints​(java.util.List<? extends java.awt.geom.Point2D> points)
      Set the positions of the the control points so that they match the given points. The number of points in the given list must be the same as the the number of points that was used to construct this spline.
      Parameters:
      points - The control points
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the number of points in the given list does not match the number of points that was given in the constructor

    • getInterpolatedPoints

      public java.util.List<java.awt.geom.Point2D> getInterpolatedPoints()
      Returns an unmodifiable list containing the interpolated points. Note that although the list itself is unmodifiable, the contained points are still modifiable. Changes in these points will be overwritten by this class, although the exact conditions under which they will be overwritten are not specified.
      Returns:
      The interpolated points
